text:
Compiled Apache 1.3.24 like:

./configure \
"--with-layout=Apache" \
"--prefix=/usr/local/apache" \
"--enable-module=vhost_alias" \
"--enable-module=rewrite" \
"--enable-module=proxy" \
"--disable-module=userdir"

When we mod_proxy to a webserver running PHP (seems to be all versions of 
PHP from 4.0 (that we have been able to test)) with IE 5.5.1 and Netscape 4.75 
additional characters (numeric) are displayed at the top left and bottom left of the 
page (ie: before <HEAD> and after </HEAD> tags). 

We tryed to replicate the fault with 1.3.19 and 1.3.23 and were unable to so it 
might be something in 1.3.24 specificly.

We are running RedHat 7.1 kernel 2.4.17 on the Apache webserver machine (in 
question).

We have down graded to 1.3.23 until this can be resolved.

Please let us know if you wish for us to test anything.
creator: timp@iserve.co.nz
slive@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 7513 ***
